pr_title: Ignore site to site vpn status check on internallbvm

timeline.bodyText: Could it cause regressions for anything others: LB, INTERNAL_LB_VM, NETSCALER_VM cc @weizhouapache @DaanHoogland
timeline.author: rhtyd

replies.bodyText: @rhtyd as far as I know, site2site vpn can only be applied on vpc vrs, so this should be ok.
replies.author: weizhouapache

replies.bodyText: @weizhouapache @ravening cc @DaanHoogland - the only type I'm not sure about is Netscalars. @PaulAngus can you comment if netscalar supports site-to-site VPN?
replies.author: rhtyd

replies.bodyText: Do we have netscaler users present and active?
replies.author: DaanHoogland

replies.bodyText: We may that's why I've pinged @PaulAngus - advice?
replies.author: rhtyd

replies.bodyText: not sure I can advise here... I say we go forward, as NetScaller should definitively NOT be marked as "VIRTUAL_ROUTER"
replies.author: andrijapanicsb

replies.bodyText: @ravening can you change the conditional to: router.getRole() == INTERNAL_LB_VM
replies.author: rhtyd

timeline.message:
Ignore site to site vpn status check on internallbvm

When the state of the site to site vpn changes, the check
is done on all the virtual routers including the internal
load balancing vm as well. It is not needed to check the
state for internal load balancing vm
